etymology.description: phonetic: 其 + semantic: 月 ('moon'); earlier forms used 日 (㫷/𣇳), later 朞.
etymology.interpretation: Sound is supplied by 其 (qí/qī), while 月 evokes the moon’s changing phases as a marker of time, yielding senses like a period or term. Earlier sun-based forms shifted to the moon to emphasize cyclical time before settling on the modern graph.

examples.chinese: 新学期开始了(新學期開始了)。
报名截止日期是下周五(報名截止日期是下週五)。
examples.pinyin: Bàomíng jiézhǐ rìqī shì xià zhōu wǔ.
examples.english: The registration deadline is next Friday.

examples.chinese: 我很期待这次比赛(我很期待這次比賽)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ hěn qīdài zhè cì bǐsài.
examples.english: I’m really looking forward to this competition.
